rev.comment: undo fair use abuse via WP:NFCC
rev.diff:
Line 16: Line 16:
===Joseph Frost===
===Joseph Frost===
â
[[Image:JosephF.jpg|thumb|right|Joseph Frost, before he is attacked by Cerberuses.]]
+
'''Joseph Frost''' is in charge of weapons and vehicle maintenance. He is described as being one of the most cheerful members of the team, but has a tendency of getting carried away during dangerous situations. In his sole appearance in ''[[Resident Evil (video game)|Resident Evil]]'', he finds the remains of Bravo Team's pilot and is then attacked and killed by a pack of zombie dogs. According to the English language manual of the original ''Resident Evil'', he was a member of S.T.A.R.S. Bravo team before being promoted to Alpha, although this is never actually supported by another source.
'''Joseph Frost''' is in charge of weapons and vehicle maintenance. He is described as being one of the most cheerful members of the team, but has a tendency of getting carried away during dangerous situations. In his sole appearance in ''[[Resident Evil (video game)|Resident Evil]]'', he finds the remains of Bravo Team's pilot and is then attacked and killed by a pack of zombie dogs. According to the English language manual of the original ''Resident Evil'', he was a member of S.T.A.R.S. Bravo team before being promoted to Alpha, although this is never actually supported by another source.
Line 24: Line 24:
===Brad Vickers===
===Brad Vickers===
â
[[Image:BradV.jpg|300px|thumb|right|Brad Vickers in ''[[Resident Evil 3: Nemesis]]'']]
 
'''Brad Vickers''' is in charge of rear security, along with [[Jill Valentine]], and serves as the team's helicopter pilot and also handles chemical protection duties. He is described as getting nervous during dangerous situations and running away at the first sight of trouble, earning him the nickname "Chickenheart".
'''Brad Vickers''' is in charge of rear security, along with [[Jill Valentine]], and serves as the team's helicopter pilot and also handles chemical protection duties. He is described as getting nervous during dangerous situations and running away at the first sight of trouble, earning him the nickname "Chickenheart".
Line 41: Line 40:
{{main|Rebecca Chambers}}
{{main|Rebecca Chambers}}
===Richard Aiken===
===Richard Aiken===
â
[[Image:RichardA.jpeg|thumb|200px|Richard Aiken in ''[[Resident Evil Zero]]''.]]
 
'''Richard Aiken''' is Bravo Team's radio operator and is specialized in using shotgun. He is also charged with looking after the inexperienced [[Rebecca Chambers]]. This young man has a bright disposition and is frank with others. He cares for people and will do whatever it takes, even at the cost of his own life, to protect someone.
'''Richard Aiken''' is Bravo Team's radio operator and is specialized in using shotgun. He is also charged with looking after the inexperienced [[Rebecca Chambers]]. This young man has a bright disposition and is frank with others. He cares for people and will do whatever it takes, even at the cost of his own life, to protect someone.
Line 52: Line 50:
===Edward Dewey===
===Edward Dewey===
â
[[Image:EdwardD.JPG|thumb|200px|Edward Dewey in ''[[Resident Evil Zero]]''.]]
 
'''Edward Dewey''' is responsible for rear security along with [[Rebecca Chambers]]. While he is Bravo Team's primary pilot, that position is taken by Kevin Dooley during the events of the games, while Edward serves as co-pilot.
'''Edward Dewey''' is responsible for rear security along with [[Rebecca Chambers]]. While he is Bravo Team's primary pilot, that position is taken by Kevin Dooley during the events of the games, while Edward serves as co-pilot.
Line 65: Line 62:
===Enrico Marini===
===Enrico Marini===
â
[[Image:EnricoM.jpeg|thumb|200px|Enrico Marini in ''[[Resident Evil Zero]]''.]]
 
'''Enrico Marini''' is Bravo Team's mission leader and second-in-command of S.T.A.R.S. under [[Albert Wesker]]. He is a veteran soldier and skilled in various survival techniques. He plays a supporting role in both ''[[Resident Evil (video game)|Resident Evil]]'' and its prequel, ''[[Resident Evil Zero]]''.
'''Enrico Marini''' is Bravo Team's mission leader and second-in-command of S.T.A.R.S. under [[Albert Wesker]]. He is a veteran soldier and skilled in various survival techniques. He plays a supporting role in both ''[[Resident Evil (video game)|Resident Evil]]'' and its prequel, ''[[Resident Evil Zero]]''.
Line 76: Line 72:
===Forest Speyer===
===Forest Speyer===
â
[[Image:ForestS.jpeg|thumb|200px|Forest Speyer in ''[[Resident Evil Zero]]''.]]
 
'''Forest Speyer''' is in charge of vehicle and weapons maintenance. He is described as being a perfectionist, and well-regarded by his teammates due to his professionalism. He also has a close friendship and rivalry with Alpha Team member [[Chris Redfield]], as they are both professional marksmen.
'''Forest Speyer''' is in charge of vehicle and weapons maintenance. He is described as being a perfectionist, and well-regarded by his teammates due to his professionalism. He also has a close friendship and rivalry with Alpha Team member [[Chris Redfield]], as they are both professional marksmen.
Line 85: Line 80:
===Kenneth J. Sullivan===
===Kenneth J. Sullivan===
â
[[Image:KennethS.jpeg|thumb|200px|Kenneth J. Sullivan in ''[[Resident Evil Zero]]''.]]
 
'''Kenneth J. Sullivan''' is Bravo Team's point man and in charge of scouting and reconnaissance. He is also an accomplished chemist, handling chemical protection duties. According to the English language manual of the first game, Kenneth found it odd that he was chosen by Wesker to be part of the elite force.
'''Kenneth J. Sullivan''' is Bravo Team's point man and in charge of scouting and reconnaissance. He is also an accomplished chemist, handling chemical protection duties. According to the English language manual of the first game, Kenneth found it odd that he was chosen by Wesker to be part of the elite force.
Line 96: Line 90:
==R.P.D. support==
==R.P.D. support==
===Kevin Dooley===
===Kevin Dooley===
â
[[image:re0kevin.jpg|thumb|200px|http://www.freewebs.com/resident-evil-zero|Kevin Dooley in ''[[Resident Evil Zero]]''.]]
 
'''Kevin Dooley''' is an [[Raccoon Police Department|R.P.D.]] officer who serves as Bravo Team's helicopter pilot. He is not an actual member of S.T.A.R.S., but takes the place of the established pilot, Edward Dewey, during the events of the games. He is only identified by name in the Nintendo GameCube remake of the original ''[[Resident Evil (video game)|Resident Evil]]'', due to a [[retcon]] by the developers in order to explain the presence of an additional member in the S.T.A.R.S. group photograph located in the team's office in ''[[Resident Evil 2]]'' and ''[[Resident Evil 3: Nemesis]]''.
'''Kevin Dooley''' is an [[Raccoon Police Department|R.P.D.]] officer who serves as Bravo Team's helicopter pilot. He is not an actual member of S.T.A.R.S., but takes the place of the established pilot, Edward Dewey, during the events of the games. He is only identified by name in the Nintendo GameCube remake of the original ''[[Resident Evil (video game)|Resident Evil]]'', due to a [[retcon]] by the developers in order to explain the presence of an additional member in the S.T.A.R.S. group photograph located in the team's office in ''[[Resident Evil 2]]'' and ''[[Resident Evil 3: Nemesis]]''.
